metadata.measurement: Relative cultural salience share within TPOT (0-100)

01_post_rationalist_epistemics.name: Post-Rationalist Epistemics
01_post_rationalist_epistemics.description: Post-rationalist epistemics represents the foundational intellectual shift that defines TPOT's departure from classical LessWrong-style rationalism. This cluster captures the movement away from pure Bayesian reasoning and logical formalism toward embracing 'gnosis' (direct experiential knowing), intuition, embodied cognition, and non-propositional ways of understanding reality. The cluster encompasses the explicit rejection of 'galaxy-brained' reasoning, the embrace of aesthetic and emotional knowledge, and the development of what practitioners call 'felt sense' epistemology. Core to the cluster is the synthesis articulated by David Chapman's Meaningness project—that systematic and non-systematic approaches must be integrated rather than chosen between. The cluster represents not anti-rationalism but a sophisticated critique that rationality's tools are necessary but insufficient—that the map is not the territory, and that some territories require different navigational instruments entirely.

2019-01.description: Baseline salience as 'postrat' identity crystallizes on Twitter. The term has existed since approximately 2016 but remains loosely defined. Discourse centers on critiques of LessWrong orthodoxy and CFAR-style rationalist self-improvement. Accounts like @vgr articulate alternatives through Ribbonfarm essays on 'refactored perception.' @Meaningness provides theoretical scaffolding via the 'meta-rationality' framework. @sarahdoingthing contributes essays on 'deep laziness' as epistemic stance. The 'ingroup' identity is forming but not yet named TPOT. Key tension: rationalists who feel the Sequences didn't actually make them happier or wiser seeking alternatives.
key_manifestations: @vgr Ribbonfarm essays on 'premium mediocre' and illegibility (https://x.com/vgr)
LessWrong diaspora discussions on limits of explicit reasoning

2019-02.description: Salience rose from 4.2% to 4.3% (Δw = +0.1%). Minimal change driven by natural growth as postrat Twitter attracts new followers through Ribbonfarm and adjacent blogs. The force maintaining equilibrium is steady intellectual interest without external catalysts. Conversations increasingly distinguish between 'being rational' (good) and 'Rationalist identity' (potentially limiting). Early signs of what will become the embrace of 'woo'—tentative posts about meditation that carefully hedge against appearing New Age. @QiaochuYuan beginning to articulate felt-sense approaches to cognition.
key_manifestations: Discussions of Iain McGilchrist's 'The Master and His Emissary'

2019-03.description: Salience rose from 4.3% to 4.5% (Δw = +0.2%). Acceleration as spring brings increased Twitter activity. Growing cohort articulates frustration with effective altruism's utilitarian calculus, arguing it misses something essential about human flourishing. This represents early convergence between epistemics critique and values critique. The cluster gains energy from critiques of 'galaxy-brained' reasoning—the tendency of smart people to reason themselves into absurd conclusions through formally valid but practically insane chains of logic. @eigenrobot begins gaining prominence for pithy observations on intuition.
key_manifestations: @eigenrobot tweet threads on galaxy-brained failure modes (https://x.com/eigenrobot)
Christopher Alexander's 'A Pattern Language' discussions as alternative epistemology
Early critiques of EA longtermism as epistemic overreach

2019-04.description: Salience rose from 4.5% to 4.6% (Δw = +0.1%). Steady growth continues. Discourse increasingly references phenomenology and continental philosophy—traditions that classical rationalists dismissed as obscurantist. Heidegger, Merleau-Ponty, and embodied cognition theory enter the TPOT vocabulary via @nosilverv and adjacent accounts. This marks significant drift: incorporating academic philosophy that LessWrong explicitly rejected. The move generates some backlash from orthodox rationalist-adjacent accounts but ultimately enriches discourse.
key_manifestations: Dreyfus on AI and expertise discussions
Book discussions of 'The Embodied Mind' by Varela et al.

2019-05.description: Salience rose from 4.6% to 4.8% (Δw = +0.2%). Acceleration driven by several prominent accounts openly discussing meditation as epistemic practice—not just stress relief but a way of knowing. This represents beginning of the 'woo' convergence, though participants carefully frame experiences in scientifically respectable terms. Discussion of 'felt sense' (Eugene Gendlin's concept) becomes common vocabulary. @sashachapin early meditation discourse gaining traction. The cluster shows increasing coherence as a discourse community.
key_manifestations: Threads on 'illegible' knowledge that resists formalization

2019-06.description: Salience rose from 4.8% to 5.0% (Δw = +0.2%). The cluster breaks 5% as summer discourse intensifies. Key catalyst: growing frustration with AI safety discourse that operates purely in abstract logical space while missing embodied, contextual realities of intelligence. Postrat epistemics provides alternative framework for thinking about machine minds. The cluster increasingly positions itself as necessary corrective to MIRI-style AI theorizing. @simonsarris threads on craft knowledge and tacit skill gaining attention.
key_manifestations: Critiques of MIRI's purely logical approach to alignment
@simonsarris on craft, tacit knowledge, and expertise (https://x.com/simonsarris)
Growing references to Buddhist 'two truths' doctrine

2019-07.description: Salience rose from 5.0% to 5.1% (Δw = +0.1%). Summer slowdown limits growth. The cluster maintains salience through ongoing discussions but no major catalysts. Internal debates emerge about how far to push anti-rationalist critique without losing rigor entirely—healthy autoimmune response preventing full slide into relativism. The term 'postrat' becomes more commonly used as identity marker. @nickcammarata threads on introspection and phenomenal experience gaining followers.
key_manifestations: Nassim Taleb's 'skin in the game' epistemics discussions
James Scott 'Seeing Like a State' summer reading

2019-08.description: Salience rose from 5.1% to 5.2% (Δw = +0.1%). Slow growth continues. The cluster increasingly emphasizes 'local knowledge' and 'illegibility'—drawing on James Scott's work to critique technocratic rationalism. This provides political-economic dimension to epistemics discourse. Summer reading circles on Scott generate extended threads. The move connects epistemics to concerns about social engineering and centralized planning—themes resonant with grey-tribe libertarian sensibilities prevalent in TPOT.
key_manifestations: 'Seeing Like a State' discussion threads proliferate
Hayek's knowledge problem reframed as epistemics issue

2019-09.description: Salience rose from 5.2% to 5.4% (Δw = +0.2%). Fall activity surge. The cluster gains energy from return of regular Twitter engagement patterns. Increased discourse on limits of explicit communication—the idea that the most important things cannot be said directly but only pointed at. This Wittgensteinian theme becomes increasingly prominent. @visakanv threads on intrinsic motivation and non-verbal knowing gaining significant traction.
key_manifestations: @visakanv on intrinsic motivation and illegible knowledge (https://x.com/visakanv)
Wittgenstein-themed threads on limits of language
Discussions of Zen koans as pedagogical technology

2019-10.description: Salience rose from 5.4% to 5.6% (Δw = +0.2%). Continued growth. Minor controversy when rationalist-adjacent account dismisses postrat epistemics as 'vibes over rigor.' This generates clarifying discourse where postrat accounts articulate they're not abandoning rigor but expanding what counts as rigorous. The pushback helps define cluster boundaries. @eigenrobot gains followers through sharp responses defending intuitive knowing against dismissive critique.
key_manifestations: Threads distinguishing 'vibes' from genuine felt-sense knowing
Gary Klein's naturalistic decision making discussions

2019-11.description: Salience rose from 5.6% to 5.7% (Δw = +0.1%). Slight slowdown as Thanksgiving reduces engagement. The cluster continues consolidating gains. Discourse increasingly sophisticated, distinguishing between different types of non-propositional knowledge: procedural, embodied, aesthetic, relational. This taxonomic work creates shared vocabulary. Internal diversity acknowledged: postrat isn't monolithic but contains multiple streams (phenomenological, Buddhist, pragmatist).
key_manifestations: Taxonomies of non-propositional knowledge types circulating
@chaosprime on ritual knowledge and embodied practice (https://x.com/chaosprime)
'The Embodied Mind' book club discussions continuing
Year-end reflection threads on postrat identity consolidation

2019-12.description: Salience rose from 5.7% to 5.8% (Δw = +0.1%). Year-end reflection generates synthesis threads. Multiple accounts publish retrospectives on the postrat turn. The cluster shows stable growth trajectory—up from 4.2% to 5.8% over the year (+38%). Holiday season slightly depresses real-time engagement but long-form posts proliferate. @TylerAlterman's 'metatribe' framework gaining traction as way to understand TPOT's place in intellectual landscape.

2020-01.description: Salience rose from 5.8% to 6.0% (Δw = +0.2%). New year brings fresh energy. The cluster breaks 6% as accounts return from holiday. COVID-19 not yet dominating discourse. Increased discussion of how postrat approaches might apply to real-world problem-solving—not just critique but construction. @jasoncrawford's progress studies intersecting with postrat epistemics discussions. Roam Research early adoption beginning among postrat accounts.
key_manifestations: New year intention-setting with postrat framing

2020-02.description: Salience rose from 6.0% to 6.2% (Δw = +0.2%). COVID discourse begins emerging but not yet dominant. The cluster gains from general increase in Twitter intellectual activity as people spend more time online. Key development: increased discourse on tools for thought (Roam Research, Zettelkasten) as material manifestation of epistemics concerns. The question 'how do we actually think?' becomes practical not just philosophical.
key_manifestations: Roam Research adoption accelerating in postrat circles
Early COVID epistemic threads—how to reason about novel risk

2020-03.description: Salience surged from 6.2% to 7.5% (Δw = +1.3%). MAJOR CATALYST: COVID-19 pandemic creates massive surge for postrat epistemics. The cluster's themes—epistemic humility, limits of formal models, importance of local knowledge, distrust of centralized expertise—become acutely relevant. Lockdowns begin. Twitter activity explodes. Postrat accounts gain followers for offering alternative frameworks for understanding unprecedented situation. @Meaningness threads on nebulosity and uncertainty highly resonant.
key_manifestations: Debates on 'follow the science' as epistemically naive
@balajis early COVID threads intersecting postrat epistemics (https://x.com/balaborish)

2020-04.description: Salience rose from 7.5% to 8.2% (Δw = +0.7%). Continued COVID-driven surge. Lockdown increases Twitter engagement massively. The cluster benefits from demonstrated failures of expert consensus—early mask guidance reversal, model prediction failures, constantly shifting recommendations. Postrat epistemics positioned as having predicted exactly this kind of failure. @slatestarcodex COVID analysis threads highly influential. The discourse gains sophistication about navigating uncertainty.
key_manifestations: Threads on how experts failed (masks, models, messaging)
Growing 'skin in the game' epistemics emphasis

2020-05.description: Salience fell from 8.2% to 8.0% (Δw = -0.2%). Slight pullback as initial COVID discourse intensity normalizes. George Floyd protests beginning to redirect attention. The cluster maintains high salience but discourse diversifies beyond pure pandemic epistemics. Some convergence with political epistemics—questions about how we know what we know about contested social facts. @robinhanson prediction market epistemics discussions intersecting.
key_manifestations: Discussions of epistemics in politically charged contexts
Threads on 'narrative capture' and motivated reasoning

2020-06.description: Salience fell from 8.0% to 7.8% (Δw = -0.2%). Further decline as summer and protest discourse dominate. Scott Alexander deletes Slate Star Codex (June 22) in response to NYT doxxing threat—major community event. This impacts SSC ecosystem but generates broader reflection on pseudonymity, knowledge, and institutional power. @astralcodexten going silent shocks adjacent communities. The cluster's themes about institutional distrust resonate.
key_manifestations: Slate Star Codex deletion response threads
Discussions of pseudonymity as epistemic freedom
Critiques of mainstream media epistemology intensifying

2020-07.description: Salience rose from 7.8% to 7.9% (Δw = +0.1%). Stabilization. SSC discourse fades; COVID remains background. The cluster benefits from continued high Twitter engagement during lockdown. Increased focus on constructive epistemics—not just what's wrong with rationalism but what to build instead. 'Sensemaking' becomes increasingly popular term. @wolftivy and Palladium Magazine adjacent discourse emerging.
key_manifestations: Daniel Schmachtenberger and Game~B references increasing
Threads on 'collective intelligence' and group epistemics

2020-08.description: Salience rose from 7.9% to 8.1% (Δw = +0.2%). Slight growth as discourse matures. Key debate: is postrat epistemics compatible with 'woo' (occult, spiritual, magical thinking)? Some accounts argue yes—gnosis is gnosis regardless of framing. Others maintain scientific naturalism while embracing phenomenological approaches. @liminal_warmth emerging as voice bridging occult and epistemic discourse. Productive tension prevents collapse into either sterile philosophy or uncritical spiritualism.
key_manifestations: Debates on science and spirituality compatibility
Pragmatism (William James, John Dewey) as postrat ancestor

2020-09.description: Salience rose from 8.1% to 8.3% (Δw = +0.2%). Fall activity increase. The cluster gains from increasing awareness of 'TPOT' as named community—the term itself gaining traction over 'postrat' or 'ingroup.' Epistemics discourse remains core to TPOT identity. @patio11 threads on institutional knowledge intersecting with postrat themes. Election season brings questions about political epistemology.
key_manifestations: Election prediction as epistemics test case

2020-10.description: Salience rose from 8.3% to 8.5% (Δw = +0.2%). Pre-election intensity. The cluster grows as epistemics questions become acutely relevant: How do we know election results are valid? What counts as evidence? Who do we trust? Postrat epistemics offers sophisticated framing that transcends partisan lines. @gwern threads on forecasting and calibration gaining attention. Emphasis on local knowledge and verified trust networks.
key_manifestations: Trust network and local knowledge emphasis

2020-11.description: Salience fell from 8.5% to 8.4% (Δw = -0.1%). Post-election discourse absorbs attention. The cluster experiences slight relative decline as political discourse dominates. However, core postrat accounts use election aftermath to illustrate epistemics points: how different groups with same information reach radically different conclusions, how tribal epistemics work, how institutions gain or lose epistemic authority.
key_manifestations: Discussions of how election epistemics succeeded/failed

2020-12.description: Salience rose from 8.4% to 8.6% (Δw = +0.2%). Year-end synthesis. Multiple accounts publish 2020 retrospectives framing it as vindication of postrat epistemics. The pandemic, social unrest, election chaos—all demonstrated limits of formal reasoning and expert authority. The cluster enters 2021 with greatly expanded influence, having grown from 5.8% to 8.6% over the year (+48%). COVID lockdowns created perfect conditions.
key_manifestations: Discussions of 'unprecedented times' as epistemic category

2021-01.description: Salience rose from 8.6% to 8.8% (Δw = +0.2%). New year energy plus continued pandemic conditions. Scott Alexander returns with Astral Codex Ten (January 21), reinvigorating adjacent discourse. @astralcodexten resumption major event for rationalist-adjacent TPOT. The cluster benefits from renewed SSC/ACX ecosystem activity. January 6 Capitol events generate epistemics discourse about radicalization, divergent realities, and what 'red-pilling' means epistemically.
key_manifestations: Substack migration discourse among postrat accounts

2021-02.description: Salience rose from 8.8% to 8.9% (Δw = +0.1%). Steady continuation. The cluster increasingly emphasizes 'sensemaking' as applied epistemics. Vaccine rollout generates new epistemic questions: Who do we trust on safety? How do we evaluate novel technologies? Postrat accounts generally pro-vaccine but sophisticated about uncertainty. @zeynep threads on institutional trust resonating in TPOT.
key_manifestations: Discussions of 'doing your own research' as concept

2021-03.description: Salience rose from 8.9% to 9.1% (Δw = +0.2%). Spring energy. The cluster grows as people process pandemic's strange middle phase—vaccines available but restrictions ongoing. Questions about how we know when pandemic is 'over,' what counts as acceptable risk. Tools for thought discourse continues with Obsidian taking over from Roam as preferred tool among postrat accounts.
key_manifestations: Personal knowledge management as epistemics practice

2021-04.description: Salience fell from 9.1% to 9.0% (Δw = -0.1%). Slight pullback. Some epistemic fatigue as pandemic stretches on. Increased focus on 'vibe' and 'energy' as epistemic categories—how do we know what a situation 'feels' like? @visakanv threads on vibes and intrinsic motivation highly engaged. This represents fuller embrace of non-propositional knowing. Some accounts explicitly discussing moving from 'head' to 'heart' epistemics.

2021-05.description: Salience rose from 9.0% to 9.2% (Δw = +0.2%). First Vibecamp announced, creating excitement about IRL community. The cluster benefits from anticipation of embodied gathering—postrat epistemics emphasizing that online discourse has limits, that some knowing requires physical copresence. @deepfates and organizing team generating anticipation. This represents meta-level validation: community practicing what it preaches about embodied knowledge.
key_manifestations: Threads on 'touch grass' as genuine epistemics advice

2021-06.description: Salience rose from 9.2% to 9.3% (Δw = +0.1%). Summer optimism as pandemic feels like it might be ending (pre-Delta). Some discussions of 'post-pandemic epistemics'—what did we learn about knowing? Early AI discourse as GPT-3 API becomes more accessible to TPOT accounts. @jessi_cata and others experimenting with LLMs as thinking tools, connecting to epistemics themes.

2021-07.description: Salience fell from 9.3% to 9.2% (Δw = -0.1%). Delta variant emerges, complicating 'pandemic over' narratives. Slight cluster decline as COVID discourse returns exhausted. The cluster's response: renewed emphasis on navigating permanent uncertainty rather than waiting for clarity. This represents maturation—from hoping for epistemic resolution to accepting epistemic groundlessness as baseline. Buddhist/Zen inflections in discourse increasing.

2021-08.description: Salience rose from 9.2% to 9.4% (Δw = +0.2%). FIRST VIBECAMP happens (August 2021). Major catalyst. IRL experience validates postrat epistemics claims about embodied knowing. Accounts return with reports of 'you had to be there' experiences that resist textualization. This is epistemics performed: the community experiencing limits of their medium. @deepfates reflections widely shared. Major catalyst for community cohesion.
key_manifestations: 'You had to be there' as epistemic observation

2021-09.description: Salience rose from 9.4% to 9.6% (Δw = +0.2%). Post-Vibecamp glow continues. Increased discourse on 'community epistemics'—how groups know together, how trust networks enable knowledge that individuals cannot access. @vgr's 'scenius' concept getting renewed attention. Growing references to 'scene' knowledge, tacit norms, in-group comprehension that can't be explicitly transmitted.

2021-10.description: Salience rose from 9.6% to 9.7% (Δw = +0.1%). Steady growth. AI discourse begins intensifying as scaling paradigm shows results. Postrat epistemics increasingly applied to questions about machine minds: Do LLMs 'understand'? What would that even mean? @gwern increasingly referenced on scaling laws and AI epistemics. The cluster's emphasis on embodied, contextual knowing provides critical perspective on AI hype.
key_manifestations: Postrat critique of AI hype cycles

2021-11.description: Salience rose from 9.7% to 9.8% (Δw = +0.1%). Pre-FTX peak crypto period. Some postrat accounts engage with web3 epistemics (decentralized truth, token-curated registries). Others skeptical. The cluster itself remains focused on knowing-how questions. Growing discourse on 'network epistemics' and how information propagates through social graphs. @balajis 'network state' ideas intersecting.

2021-12.description: Salience rose from 9.8% to 10.0% (Δw = +0.2%). The cluster breaks 10%, representing nearly 2.5x influence since 2019 baseline. Year-end synthesis establishes postrat epistemics as core TPOT identity. The community has matured: vocabulary standardized, key figures established, relationship to rationalism clarified (not rejection but transcendence-and-inclusion). @eigenrobot's increasingly influential voice crystallizing postrat stance.

2022-01.description: Salience rose from 10.0% to 10.2% (Δw = +0.2%). New year energy. Key development: increasing integration of 'somatics' and body-based knowing. Threads on how physical practice (yoga, martial arts, dance) generates knowledge that intellectual work cannot. @QiaochuYuan threads on somatic experience gaining significant traction. This represents practical turn—from discussing embodied epistemics to practicing it.

2022-02.description: Salience rose from 10.2% to 10.3% (Δw = +0.1%). Russia invades Ukraine (Feb 24), creating new epistemics crisis: fog of war, competing narratives, OSINT culture. The cluster provides frameworks for navigating information warfare. @KelseyTuoc and others applying postrat epistemics to wartime information evaluation. Emphasis on epistemic humility, multiple sources, recognizing tribal loyalties.
key_manifestations: Fog of war and narrative competition

2022-03.description: Salience rose from 10.3% to 10.5% (Δw = +0.2%). War discourse continues driving epistemics discussion. The cluster shows how postrat frameworks apply to acute crisis: How do we know what's really happening? Who benefits from which narratives? @tszzl threads on epistemics and information quality gaining attention. Tetlock and superforecasting references increasing.
key_manifestations: 'How we actually know things' in crisis

2022-04.description: Salience fell from 10.5% to 10.4% (Δw = -0.1%). Slight pullback as war discourse normalizes. Internal debates about @eigenrobot's increasingly influential framing—particularly the rejection of logic for gnosis. Some accounts argue this goes too far into anti-rationalism. Others embrace the provocation. Healthy contestation about where postrat epistemics draws lines.

2022-05.description: Salience rose from 10.4% to 10.6% (Δw = +0.2%). Vibecamp 2 approaches. Growing discourse on 'vibe-based epistemics'—half-ironic, half-serious exploration of how aesthetic and emotional knowledge work. @acczibit threads on vibes and perception gaining traction. The language of 'vibes' increasingly theorized rather than just used—meta-level development where community analyzes its own vernacular.

2022-06.description: Salience rose from 10.6% to 10.8% (Δw = +0.2%). VIBECAMP 2 happens. Larger attendance than first event. Post-event discourse emphasizes how much of community knowledge is tacit, embodied, relational—resistant to online transmission. @sonyasupposedly post-Vibecamp threads resonating. The event validates epistemics claims while creating paradox: insights from in-person gathering can only be gesturally indicated online.

2022-07.description: Salience fell from 10.8% to 10.7% (Δw = -0.1%). Post-Vibecamp normalization. Summer slowdown. Internal discussions about Vibecamp becoming 'too big' or mainstream—is the magic sustainable at scale? This represents epistemics question in action: does community knowledge survive growth? @vgr on scene life cycles. Some accounts worry about losing illegibility.

2022-08.description: Salience rose from 10.7% to 10.9% (Δw = +0.2%). Late summer pickup. Stable Diffusion and image generation going mainstream. The cluster's epistemics discourse applies to new questions: What does AI-generated imagery mean for visual knowledge? How do we know what's real? @RokoMijic threads on synthetic media epistemics. This is postrat epistemics meeting practical crisis, similar to COVID but for information authenticity.

2022-09.description: Salience rose from 10.9% to 11.1% (Δw = +0.2%). Fall activity increase. The cluster benefits from intensifying AI discourse. Growing schism visible: some accounts embrace AI acceleration, others worry about safety. Postrat epistemics cuts across this divide, applicable to both camps' sensemaking about unprecedented technology. @micsolana engaging with postrat ideas from tech-optimist angle.

2022-10.description: Salience rose from 11.1% to 11.3% (Δw = +0.2%). Pre-FTX period. Continued AI discourse. The cluster increasingly integrated with AI alignment discourse, though maintaining distinctive postrat framing. @ESYudkowsky engagement generating responses applying postrat critique to MIRI-style approaches. Some argue alignment researchers have epistemic blindspots postrat can illuminate.

2022-11.description: Salience surged from 11.3% to 12.5% (Δw = +1.2%). MAJOR CATALYST: FTX collapse (November 8-11). Massive surge as EA/rationalist-adjacent fraud validates postrat critiques. Key themes: How did smart people get fooled? What epistemic failures enabled SBF? The cluster's emphasis on 'skin in the game,' tacit knowledge, distrust of pure logic, embodied signals—all vindicated. @eigenrobot 'we tried to warn you' threads resonating widely.

2022-12.description: Salience rose from 12.5% to 12.8% (Δw = +0.3%). FTX fallout continues. ChatGPT launches (November 30) creating second massive catalyst—AI goes mainstream. The cluster benefits from both: FTX shows limits of rationalist epistemics, ChatGPT demands new frameworks for machine minds. @gwern threads on ChatGPT capabilities epistemics. Year ends with postrat epistemics at peak relevance.

2023-01.description: Salience rose from 12.8% to 13.0% (Δw = +0.2%). AI discourse dominant post-ChatGPT. The cluster's epistemics questions now feel urgent: What is machine 'understanding'? How do we evaluate AI claims? Can we trust our own intuitions about AI? @nickcammarata threads on AI phenomenology highly engaged. Some accounts specialize in 'AI epistemics' specifically.

2023-02.description: Salience rose from 13.0% to 13.2% (Δw = +0.2%). Sydney/Bing controversy (February) generates discussion about AI capabilities and our ability to know them. @jessi_cata threads on Bing behavior highly engaged. The cluster emphasizes humility: we don't understand these systems, and our tools for understanding are products of pre-LLM era. Unknown unknowns prominent.

2023-03.description: Salience rose from 13.2% to 13.5% (Δw = +0.3%). GPT-4 launches (March 14). AI discourse reaches fever pitch. 'Pause Giant AI Experiments' open letter (March 22). @ESYudkowsky Time magazine op-ed 'Shut it All Down' (March 29). The cluster benefits from sustained attention to epistemics questions at civilizational scale. @eigenrobot threads on civilizational epistemics.

2023-04.description: Salience fell from 13.5% to 13.4% (Δw = -0.1%). Slight pullback from March intensity. The cluster shows maturation: initial shock giving way to sustained analysis. Increasing integration of AI tools into postrat practice—using LLMs as thinking partners, exploring what they reveal about cognition. @visakanv on AI writing partners. Experimental turn: not just analyzing AI epistemics but practicing with AI.

2023-05.description: Salience rose from 13.4% to 13.6% (Δw = +0.2%). E/acc vs doomer discourse crystallizes. The cluster provides meta-perspective: both camps may be epistemically overconfident. @wolftivy call for alternative to 'doomer accelerationism.' Postrat epistemics skeptical of both 'we can predict doom' and 'we can predict flourishing.' Some accounts explicitly 'neither e/acc nor doomer.'

2023-06.description: Salience rose from 13.6% to 13.8% (Δw = +0.2%). Vibecamp 3 approaches. AI discourse remains high but moderated. @eigenrobot's gnosis-pinned-tweet becomes referenced touchstone—symbol of postrat epistemics stance. Discourse increasingly sophisticated about what 'gnosis' actually means: not anti-logic but trans-logic, integrating propositional and non-propositional knowing.

2023-07.description: Salience rose from 13.8% to 13.9% (Δw = +0.1%). VIBECAMP 3 happens (~800 attendees). Largest yet. Post-event discourse emphasizes community growth but also challenges of maintaining intimacy and trust at scale. @deepfates retrospectives widely shared. The cluster applies frameworks reflexively: how does epistemic community change with size? What knowledge structures survive growth?

2023-08.description: Salience fell from 13.9% to 13.7% (Δw = -0.2%). Post-Vibecamp normalization, summer slowdown. Some disillusionment: has the community peaked? Concerns about mainstreaming diluting postrat distinctiveness. Key debate: should postrat epistemics remain elite/illegible or become more accessible? No resolution but productive tension. @vgr on scenes and their life cycles.

2023-09.description: Salience rose from 13.7% to 13.9% (Δw = +0.2%). Fall energy returns. Claude 2 and other models proliferating. Increasing discourse on 'LLM epistemics'—how do we know what these models can do? Benchmark limitations. Eval problems. @gwern threads on capability elicitation epistemics. The cluster's emphasis on tacit knowledge and limits of formal evaluation resonates with AI evaluation challenges.

2023-10.description: Salience rose from 13.9% to 14.1% (Δw = +0.2%). The cluster approaches peak. Elon Musk X chaos generates platform epistemics concerns. Some accounts discussing Bluesky migration. The cluster applies frameworks to platform choice: what do we know about each platform's effects on discourse? @sonyasupposedly on platform epistemics. Meta-level analysis of medium and message.

2023-11.description: Salience surged from 14.1% to 14.5% (Δw = +0.4%). MAJOR CATALYST: Sam Altman OpenAI firing/rehiring (November 17-22). The cluster surges as AI governance epistemics become acute: Who knew what? What does the board know? What can outsiders know? @KelseyTuoc threads on OpenAI epistemics highly engaged. Crisis validates postrat emphasis on institutional knowledge problems and information asymmetry.
key_manifestations: 'What does anyone actually know here?' threads

2023-12.description: Salience rose from 14.5% to 14.8% (Δw = +0.3%). Year-end at near-peak salience. The cluster consolidates 2023 gains. AI has transformed discourse completely—postrat epistemics now primarily oriented around machine minds, capability evaluation, governance knowledge problems. @eigenrobot year-end synthesis threads. Looking forward: questions about whether AI itself will transform epistemics.

2024-01.description: Salience rose from 14.8% to 15.0% (Δw = +0.2%). The cluster breaks 15%, representing peak influence (~3.5x 2019 baseline). New year brings continued AI focus. Increasing discourse on 'post-LLM epistemics'—how knowing changes when AI is always available. @visakanv on human-AI collaborative knowing. Some argue postrat frameworks need updating; others maintain human embodied epistemics remains central.
key_manifestations: Human embodiment vs AI tools debates

2024-02.description: Salience fell from 15.0% to 14.8% (Δw = -0.2%). Slight pullback from peak. Some normalization as AI becomes background rather than crisis. Internal debates about whether cluster has 'won'—postrat epistemics now mainstream in TPOT. Some concern about losing edge as ideas diffuse. @vgr on idea diffusion cycles. Others see broad adoption as success rather than dilution.

2024-03.description: Salience rose from 14.8% to 14.9% (Δw = +0.1%). Claude 3 launches (March 4). Opus model specifically generates discourse about AI 'consciousness' or 'understanding'—exactly the questions postrat epistemics has been developing frameworks for. @nickcammarata threads on Claude phenomenology. Some argue Claude 3 represents qualitative shift; others maintain continuity with existing frameworks.

2024-04.description: Salience fell from 14.9% to 14.7% (Δw = -0.2%). Slight decline. Spring brings some discourse fatigue. Core questions remain relevant but less acute after years of crisis-mode. Some accounts discuss epistemics exhaustion. @chaosprime on sustainable intellectual practice. Calls for consolidation rather than new frameworks.

2024-05.description: Salience rose from 14.7% to 14.8% (Δw = +0.1%). GPT-4o launch and AI product intensification. Multimodal AI epistemics—how do we know what voice/vision models understand? @jessi_cata on multimodal capabilities. Vibecamp 2024 anticipation building. Community prepares for another IRL epistemics experience.

2024-06.description: Salience rose from 14.8% to 15.0% (Δw = +0.2%). VIBECAMP 2024 energy. Returns to 15%. IRL gathering reinforces core themes. Post-event threads emphasize maturation: shared vocabulary, trust networks, implicit understanding that didn't exist in 2019. @deepfates on 5+ years of community epistemics. The cluster reflects on its own development.

2024-07.description: Salience fell from 15.0% to 14.8% (Δw = -0.2%). Post-Vibecamp normalization, summer slowdown. Internal discourse becomes more reflexive—community analyzing its own epistemics, asking whether it has learned what it set out to learn. @vgr on epistemic community sustainability. Some concern about stagnation; others argue steady-state is success.

2024-08.description: Salience rose from 14.8% to 14.9% (Δw = +0.1%). Late summer pickup. AI discourse continues with frontier model governance focus. @KelseyTuoc on regulatory epistemics. Questions about what regulators/institutions can know about AI systems. Postrat emphasis on limits of formal evaluation directly relevant to policy debates.

2024-09.description: Salience rose from 14.9% to 15.1% (Δw = +0.2%). Fall activity increase. Election season brings epistemics questions: AI-generated political content, deepfakes, synthetic media. @RokoMijic on election information epistemics. Postrat frameworks applied to new information environment—multi-layered uncertainty with AI dimension added to 2020's challenges.

2024-10.description: Salience rose from 15.1% to 15.3% (Δw = +0.2%). Pre-election intensity. Multi-layered uncertainty: human political epistemics plus AI uncertainty. @tszzl on layered epistemics frameworks. Some accounts develop frameworks for 'layered knowing' that distinguish between human and machine-generated uncertainty. Sophisticated integration of 2020 lessons with AI era.

2024-11.description: Salience fell from 15.3% to 15.0% (Δw = -0.3%). Post-election (Trump wins November 5). Discourse absorbs political shift. Cluster experiences relative decline as attention moves to political rather than epistemic questions. @eigenrobot uses election to illustrate postrat themes: different communities constructed different realities. Institutional epistemics failed differently for different groups.

2024-12.description: Salience fell from 15.0% to 14.8% (Δw = -0.2%). Luigi Mangione UHC shooting (December 4) brings unexpected TPOT visibility. Media discovers 'grey tribe' and TPOT connections. The cluster experiences strange moment: mainstream attention on community that valued illegibility. @vgr on what visibility means for epistemic communities. Internal discourse on maintaining community under external gaze.

2025-01.description: Salience fell from 14.8% to 14.6% (Δw = -0.2%). New year begins with some retrenchment. Mangione visibility created wariness about external attention. Cluster maintains high salience but discourse becomes more careful, more internal. Some accounts discuss need to restore illegibility. @chaosprime on epistemic community boundaries. Others argue visibility is inevitable and community should adapt.

2025-02.description: Salience fell from 14.6% to 14.5% (Δw = -0.1%). Continued slight decline as community processes visibility concerns. Discourse on 'post-mainstream' epistemics—what does postrat look like when ideas have partially diffused? @TylerAlterman on metatribe evolution. Some argue for renewed emphasis on advanced topics that can't easily mainstream.

2025-03.description: Salience rose from 14.5% to 14.6% (Δw = +0.1%). Spring recovery. Cluster stabilizes. New AI capabilities generate renewed epistemics questions. Community moves past visibility concerns. @Meaningness on 'mature postrat'—integrating years of development into coherent framework rather than constant innovation. Emphasis on depth over novelty.

2025-04.description: Salience rose from 14.6% to 14.7% (Δw = +0.1%). Steady growth. Increasing discourse on 'applied postrat epistemics'—how frameworks translate to actual decisions about careers, relationships, technology adoption. @patio11 on institutional epistemics in practice. Practical turn continues: from theory to application.

2025-05.description: Salience rose from 14.7% to 14.9% (Δw = +0.2%). Pre-Vibecamp energy. Cluster approaches 15% again. Anticipation of IRL gathering generates discourse on what community has learned over 6+ years. @deepfates on comparative analysis: early TPOT vs current. Emphasis on tacit community knowledge and how new members access it.

2025-06.description: Salience rose from 14.9% to 15.2% (Δw = +0.3%). VIBECAMP 2025 happens. Major gathering generates peak cluster salience. IRL experience reinforces all core themes. @sonyasupposedly on maturity of community epistemics—participants communicate efficiently via shared frameworks developed over years. Cluster reaches new high-water mark.

2025-07.description: Salience fell from 15.2% to 15.0% (Δw = -0.2%). Post-Vibecamp summer decline. Typical pattern. Discourse becomes reflective: what has 6+ years of postrat epistemics development produced? @vgr on consolidation vs innovation. Some argue for consolidation; others push new directions. Healthy internal diversity maintained.

2025-08.description: Salience rose from 15.0% to 15.1% (Δw = +0.1%). Late summer recovery. New capability demonstrations generate renewed discourse. @gwern on AI scaling developments. Community frameworks prove durable—core concepts from 2019-2020 still relevant with updates. Emphasis on framework resilience across changing technological landscape.

2025-09.description: Salience rose from 15.1% to 15.3% (Δw = +0.2%). Fall engagement increase. Discourse on 'postrat epistemics 2.0'—what comes after initial framework development? @TylerAlterman on expanded scope (organizational epistemics, civilizational sensemaking). Others prefer deepening existing frameworks. Productive tension continues.

2025-10.description: Salience rose from 15.3% to 15.5% (Δw = +0.2%). Continued fall growth. Increasing discourse on institutionalizing postrat epistemics—should there be more formal structures (courses, publications, organizations)? @wolftivy on institutional design. Others prefer informal scene. No consensus but productive discussion.

2025-11.description: Salience fell from 15.5% to 15.4% (Δw = -0.1%). Slight stabilization near peak. Pre-holiday patterns. Discourse emphasizes sustainability: how does epistemic community maintain itself over multi-year timeframes? @vgr on scene sustainability. Lessons from 6+ years synthesized. Focus on succession—how ideas transmit to newcomers.

2025-12.description: Salience rose from 15.4% to 15.6% (Δw = +0.2%). Year-end 2025 sees cluster at new peak. Seven years of development have produced mature epistemic community with distinctive frameworks, shared vocabulary, trust networks, and practical applications. The fundamental insight—that rationality is necessary but not sufficient, that embodied and tacit knowing matter—has become widely accepted within TPOT. Questions remain about mainstream diffusion and AI integration, but the cluster has demonstrated remarkable durability. @eigenrobot 7-year synthesis threads crystallize the journey.

02_ai_existential_risk_alignment.name: AI Existential Risk & Alignment Discourse
02_ai_existential_risk_alignment.description: TPOT's engagement with existential risk from artificial intelligence and the technical/philosophical challenge of alignment. Rooted in rationalist origins (LessWrong, MIRI, Eliezer Yudkowsky's writings), AI risk discourse has been foundational to TPOT's intellectual DNA. The cluster encompasses p(doom) estimates, takeoff scenarios, alignment research, and visceral fear of human extinction. Key voices include @ESYudkowsky, @gwern, @robbensinger, @katjasgrace, and @AISafetyMemes, with alignment researchers like @paaborenstein, @RichardMCNgo, and @stuhlmueller providing technical depth. Experienced explosive growth from late 2022 as GPT-4 and subsequent models made abstract concerns concrete, culminating in the mainstream 'AI safety moment' of 2023. Unlike purely technical discussion, TPOT's engagement carries distinctive emotional texture—genuine fear, dark humor, and ongoing debate about whether doom is avoidable.

2019-01.description: Baseline salience as AI risk discourse begins substantial given TPOT's rationalist origins. Discussion centers on long-term concerns: intelligence explosion, value alignment, control problem. Δw=N/A (baseline). AGI still seems distant; mood theoretical rather than urgent.
key_manifestations: LessWrong posts on AI timelines circulated by @QiaochuYuan

2019-02.description: Slight decline. Normal steady-state discourse. GPT-2 released (Feb 14) with staged release—generates discussion but models still feel weak enough that existential risk seems abstract. Δw=-0.1.

2019-03.description: Continued slight decline. Steady baseline operations. Discussion of alignment research directions: RLHF emerging, debate amplification, impact measures. Δw=-0.1. Technical discourse dominates over existential dread.

2019-04.description: Minimal fluctuation. Cluster benefits from general TPOT growth while maintaining proportional share. Δw=+0.1. @ESYudkowsky threads on intelligence explosion continue. Some AI winter possibility discussions.

2019-05.description: Slight uptick. Growing interest in OpenAI direction—Microsoft investment raises questions about commercial pressures on safety. Δw=+0.1. Early 'race to the bottom' discourse emerges.

2019-06.description: Summer brings steady engagement. Growing discourse on where safety-focused researchers should work. Δw=+0.1. Debates about 'working within' dangerous labs vs creating alternatives.

2019-07.description: Typical summer slowdown. 'Fast takeoff' vs 'slow takeoff' debates continue. Δw=-0.1. Some accounts argue scaling won't work; others see signs of capability increase. Mood intellectual rather than urgent.

2019-08.description: Late summer pickup. GPT-2 1.5B model released (August). Continued staged release discussion. Δw=+0.1. Early pattern emerges: each capability release triggers safety discussion.

2019-09.description: Fall activity increase. Some accounts updating toward shorter timelines based on scaling evidence. Δw=+0.2. Early 'scaling hypothesis' proponents gaining attention. @gwern increasingly influential.

2019-10.description: Steady growth. Debates about whether GPT architecture can scale to AGI-relevant capabilities. Δw=+0.1. Some skepticism remains but tide beginning to turn.

2019-11.description: Pre-GPT-3 period. OpenAI working on larger models; some insider hints generate discussion. Δw=+0.1. Anticipation of next capability jump building.

2019-12.description: Year-end steady state. Cluster ends 2019 modestly above start. AI risk important background concern but not dominant discourse. Δw=+0.1. AGI still feels distant to most.

2020-01.description: New year energy. Cluster breaks 7% with growing timeline concern. Scaling evidence accumulating. Δw=+0.2. Some accounts explicitly updating timelines shorter. Pre-COVID discourse patterns.

2020-02.description: Steady continuation. COVID beginning but AI discourse continues. Δw=+0.1. Parallels drawn between pandemic preparation failure and AI safety: 'we don't take low-probability high-impact risks seriously.'

2020-03.description: DECLINE as COVID dominates. Cluster loses relative share as pandemic becomes all-consuming. Δw=-0.6. However, COVID used as extended metaphor for AI risk: warnings ignored, exponential processes misunderstood.
key_manifestations: AI risk as COVID parallel framing by @RokoMijic

2020-04.description: Continued COVID suppression. Cluster maintains reduced share. Δw=-0.3. Some use lockdown time for deeper alignment study. LessWrong activity continues independently.

2020-05.description: Slight recovery as COVID normalizes. GPT-3 paper released (May 28)—major catalyst. Δw=+0.1. 'Few-shot learning' capabilities shock ripples through TPOT. Some first genuine timeline alarm.

2020-06.description: GPT-3 API launch (June 11) drives MAJOR SURGE. Capabilities exceed expectations for many. Δw=+0.9. Abstract AI risk becomes more concrete. @ESYudkowsky concern intensifies.

2020-07.description: GPT-3 discourse continues. Demonstrations proliferate. Debates about what GPT-3 can and can't do. Δw=+0.3. 'Stochastic parrot' framing emerges from critics.

2020-08.description: Steady high engagement. GPT-3 remaining novel. Growing discourse on safety implications—if this continues to scale, what happens? Δw=+0.1. Internal debate healthy.

2020-09.description: Fall renewed engagement. OpenAI exclusive licensing to Microsoft (Sept 22) generates concern about commercialization pressures. Δw=+0.1. Lab governance becomes bigger topic.

2020-10.description: Pre-election period. Some parallels drawn between political polarization and potential AI manipulation. Δw=+0.1. Concerns about GPT-generated disinformation in elections.

2020-11.description: Post-election absorbs attention. Slight decline. Δw=-0.2. Anthropic founding announced—significant event for safety-focused research. Insider discussion of new safety lab.

2020-12.description: Year-end synthesis. GPT-3 changed the discourse. Cluster ends 2020 higher than 2019 despite COVID competition. Δw=+0.2. Growing sense that timelines might be shorter.

2021-01.description: New year energy. Cluster breaks 8%. Anthropic formally launches. Δw=+0.2. Major event: safety-focused lab with significant resources. TPOT celebrates while noting challenges.

2021-02.description: Continued growth. CLIP and DALL-E (January) generate discussions about multimodal AI. Δw=+0.2. Capabilities expanding beyond text. Concern about capability breadth.

2021-03.description: Steady growth. Discussions of alignment research hiring—more resources flowing. Δw=+0.1. Some optimism about safety research pace. Others worry capability research still faster.

2021-04.description: Slight pullback. Spring normalization. Δw=-0.1. Internal debates about productive vs doomer posting—is constant alarm useful or does it create fatigue?

2021-05.description: Recovery. Growing discourse on compute governance—should there be limits on training large models? Δw=+0.2. Early compute governance threads emerge.

2021-06.description: Summer steady state. Copilot announced (June 29)—AI in software development. Δw=+0.1. Some TPOT accounts use it. Concerns about AI capability in economic domains.

2021-07.description: Summer slowdown. Cluster maintains share but loses slight energy. Δw=-0.1. Some accounts taking 'AI summer' breaks from doom discourse. Topic feels urgent and exhausting.

2021-08.description: Late summer pickup. 'Foundation models' paper (August) coins influential term. Δw=+0.2. Paradigm framing generates discourse about AI concentration. Research clarity vs concentration debates.

2021-09.description: Fall activity increase. Scaling evidence accumulates. Chinchilla training efficiency results suggest longer runway. Δw=+0.2. @gwern increasingly referenced on scaling laws.

2021-10.description: Cluster breaks 9%. Increasing sense that AGI timelines might be shorter than long assumed. Δw=+0.2. Some accounts explicitly state 'I was wrong about timelines.' @ESYudkowsky concern becoming more acute.

2021-11.description: Continued growth. Gopher (280B parameters) released by DeepMind. More scaling evidence. Δw=+0.2. Some accounts updating toward 'it might just work.' Alignment research feels increasingly urgent.

2021-12.description: Year-end at elevated level. 2021 saw significant growth. Year-end retrospectives note: faster progress than expected, safety research not keeping pace. Δw=+0.2. p(doom) estimates circulating more widely.

2022-01.description: New year with heightened concern. Cluster approaches 10%. InstructGPT paper hints at what becomes ChatGPT. Δw=+0.2. RLHF discourse expands—safety tool or just making models more persuasive?

2022-02.description: Steady growth. Ukraine invasion (Feb 24) temporarily diverts attention but AI discourse continues. Δw=+0.1. Parallels drawn: existential risks from war and AI both underestimated.

2022-03.description: Steady continuation. PaLM (540B) rumors generate discourse. Scaling race heating up. Δw=+0.1. Discourse on competitive dynamics—are labs racing unsafely? DeepMind Gato concerns.

2022-04.description: SIGNIFICANT GROWTH. DALL-E 2 (April 6) public release. Visual generative AI breakthrough. Δw=+0.4. Cluster expands as capabilities demonstrate rapid progress across modalities. 'We're not ready' sentiment grows.

2022-05.description: Continued growth. Stable Diffusion and image generation discourse heating up. Δw=+0.2. Near-term harms and long-term risks both accelerating. Mood shifting toward alarm.

2022-06.description: Summer but high engagement. @ESYudkowsky increasingly dire warnings. Some explicit high p(doom) estimates shared publicly. Δw=+0.2. Internal debates about whether doom talk is productive or paralyzing.

2022-07.description: Slight summer pullback. Cluster maintains high salience. Internal diversity healthy: some very doom, some moderately concerned, some optimistic. Δw=-0.1. No resolution on appropriate emotional response.

2022-08.description: Late summer surge. Stable Diffusion open release (Aug 22) democratizes image generation. Capabilities spreading beyond labs. Δw=+0.3. Discourse on containment impossibility.

2022-09.description: Cluster breaks 11%. Fall brings intensified concern. Discourse on approaching inflection—capabilities advancing rapidly. Δw=+0.2. @ESYudkowsky increasingly treating situation as emergency.

2022-10.description: Continued growth. Pre-ChatGPT period but anticipation building. OpenAI clearly working on something. Δw=+0.3. Debates about what next capability jump means for alignment.

2022-11.description: FTX collapse (Nov 8-11) impacts adjacent EA/alignment funding. But ChatGPT announcement/preview coming. Δw=+0.7. Cluster surges with dual shock: EA crisis and capability breakthrough. @ESYudkowsky alarm-posting intensifies.

2022-12.description: CHATGPT PUBLIC LAUNCH (Nov 30, effects felt December). Massive catalyst. Cluster EXPLODES. Δw=+2.5. AI capabilities become mainstream conversation. 'This is what we warned about' sentiment. Fastest viral AI product ever.

2023-01.description: Post-ChatGPT new year. Cluster at elevated plateau. Everyone discussing AI capabilities. Δw=+0.7. @ESYudkowsky alarm intensifies. Growing discourse on 'we might actually die.' Some processing grief/fear.

2023-02.description: Continued high engagement. Sydney/Bing (February) demonstrates chatbot capabilities and weirdness. Δw=+0.3. Debates about what counts as evidence for AI consciousness or goals.

2023-03.description: GPT-4 LAUNCH (March 14). MAJOR capability jump. 'Pause Giant AI Experiments' open letter (March 22). @ESYudkowsky Time op-ed 'Shut It All Down' (March 29). Δw=+1.3. Near-peak as mainstream legitimization of concern.

2023-04.description: Slight pullback from March peak. Cluster normalizes at high level. Δw=-0.3. Debates about pause letter effectiveness—symbolic vs practical. Growing discourse on what to actually do.

2023-05.description: Continued slight decline. E/acc discourse crystallizing as opposition to doom. Cluster experiences internal schism. Δw=-0.3. @BasedBeffJezos and e/acc gaining visibility.

2023-06.description: Further slight decline as fatigue sets in. Cluster maintains high salience but acute urgency fades into chronic concern. Δw=-0.2. Some accounts explicitly discuss burnout from doom discourse.

2023-07.description: Summer decline pattern. Some accounts taking explicit breaks from doom. Vibecamp provides alternative focus. Δw=-0.2. Underlying concern remains but expression diversifies.

2023-08.description: Continued summer decline. Cluster at lower-but-still-high plateau. Δw=-0.3. Internal debates about whether concern has been absorbed or ignored by mainstream. Authenticity questions arise.

2023-09.description: Fall recovery. Claude 2 and other models generating continued capability discourse. Δw=+0.3. Anthropic's approach debated—are they succeeding at safe development? Constitutional AI discourse.

2023-10.description: Continued recovery. UK AI Safety Summit approaching. Biden executive order (Oct 30) on AI generates significant discussion. Δw=+0.4. First major US AI policy action.

2023-11.description: OPENAI BOARD CRISIS (Nov 17-22). Sam Altman fired then rehired. MASSIVE catalyst. Δw=+2.3. Cluster EXPLODES as AI governance drama unfolds publicly. Safety concerns revealed as factor in firing. Deepest engagement with AI governance ever.

2023-12.description: Post-OpenAI-drama normalization. Cluster remains at high level but acute crisis passed. Δw=-0.7. Year-end synthesis at record high. 2023 represented breakthrough year for AI risk mainstream attention.

2024-01.description: New year with moderated urgency. Cluster remains very high but some fatigue. Δw=-0.6. Debates about 2024 as 'decisive year' or not. GPT-5 anticipation begins.

2024-02.description: Continued moderation. Cluster shows stabilization at elevated level. Δw=-0.4. Discourse on AI job displacement beginning to overlap with existential risk. Gemini 1.5 (February) with long context generates capability discourse.

2024-03.description: CLAUDE 3 LAUNCH (March 4). Opus model generates significant discourse about capability levels. Δw=+0.7. Some argue dangerous capability increase. Constitutional AI evaluated in practice.

2024-04.description: Post-Claude normalization. Cluster moderates. Δw=-0.5. Internal debates about whether safety researchers making progress. Interpretability discourse. Alignment pessimism vs cautious optimism.

2024-05.description: GPT-4o launch (May). Multimodal capabilities expand—voice and vision integration. Δw=+0.3. Discourse on capability acceleration. Debates about how to evaluate actual risk level.

2024-06.description: Summer decline begins. Cluster moderates. Vibecamp provides alternative focus. Δw=-0.3. Sustainability discussions—can't stay in crisis mode forever. Looking for stable engagement patterns.

2024-07.description: Summer low. Cluster at reduced but still high level. Δw=-0.5. Less frantic pace allows deeper analysis. Some threads on technical alignment progress. Interpretability research updates circulated.

2024-08.description: Late summer recovery. AI frontier model training continues. Δw=+0.3. Discourse on what next generation brings. Timeline predictions shortening again based on scaling trends.

2024-09.description: Fall increase. Election season brings AI policy discourse. California AI bills generate significant discussion. Δw=+0.4. State-level AI governance as precedent.

2024-10.description: Pre-election peak. AI policy as campaign issue (minor). Discourse on what Trump vs Harris means for AI governance. Δw=+0.3. International AI governance also discussed.

2024-11.description: Post-election (Trump wins Nov 5). Cluster declines as political discourse absorbs attention. Δw=-0.7. E/acc aligned figures celebrating. Schism visible between doomer and accelerationist camps.
key_manifestations: Visible schism between @ESYudkowsky doomers and accelerationists

2024-12.description: Year-end 2024. Luigi Mangione event creates unexpected TPOT visibility but AI cluster continues separately. Δw=-0.3. Year-end synthesis at high level. 2024 saw continued capability advance without breakthrough.
key_manifestations: @NateSilver538 doom distance debates (late arrival to discourse)

2025-01.description: New year with continued moderation. Cluster remains at elevated baseline. Δw=-0.3. Trump administration beginning. Some accounts tracking potential deregulation. Others focusing on technical progress regardless of politics.

2025-02.description: Continued steady decline. Cluster shows settling pattern. Δw=-0.2. AI discourse becomes more normalized—important but not constantly acute. Tension between sustainable engagement and necessary urgency.

2025-03.description: Spring recovery. New model releases generate capability discourse. Δw=+0.3. Familiar cycle: capability release → concern spike → normalization. Community knows how to engage with novel capabilities.

2025-04.description: Continued spring engagement. Discourse on 2+ years since ChatGPT. What has changed? Are we safer? Δw=+0.2. Evidence increasingly available from deployed systems.

2025-05.description: Pre-summer engagement. Cluster benefits from sustained attention. Δw=+0.3. Discussions of Vibecamp 2025 integrating AI topics. Anticipation of IRL discourse on existential themes.

2025-06.description: Vibecamp 2025 happens. AI topics significant component of in-person discussions. Δw=+0.2. Some accounts report emotional processing of doom fears. Community supporting each other through uncertainty.

2025-07.description: Post-Vibecamp summer decline. Cluster moderates. Some accounts on doom break. Δw=-0.5. Continued steady discourse from core participants. Community knows its seasonal rhythms.

2025-08.description: Late summer recovery. New capability demonstrations generate discourse. Δw=+0.3. Cluster shows resilience—always returns to elevated engagement. Processing extended uncertainty.

2025-09.description: Fall engagement increase. Discourse on approaching 3 years since ChatGPT. Still no AGI but capabilities advanced significantly. Δw=+0.4. Timeline debates continue; some revising predictions.

2025-10.description: Continued fall growth. Discourse on next frontier model generation. What would constitute 'AGI' and how would we know? Δw=+0.3. Definitional debates continue. Evidence interpretation remains contested.

2025-11.description: Slight pre-holiday decline. Typical November pattern. Δw=-0.2. Thanksgiving reduces engagement. Year-end synthesis begins early among dedicated participants.

2025-12.description: Year-end 2025. Cluster closes period at elevated stable level. Δw=-0.3. Seven years of TPOT AI risk discourse from 2019 baseline. Massive transformation: abstract concern → mainstream legitimacy → sustained engagement. TPOT's most important contribution to broader discourse.

03_therapeutic_healing_culture.name: Therapeutic/Healing Culture
03_therapeutic_healing_culture.description: TPOT's distinctive embrace of therapy, trauma processing, emotional work, and psychological healing as central concerns. Unlike mainstream rationalism's focus on cognitive optimization, TPOT developed a culture that takes seriously the 'shadow work' of emotional processing, attachment repair, and somatic healing. Key influences include Internal Family Systems (IFS), somatic approaches drawing on Peter Levine and Bessel van der Kolk, and the broader 'healing' orientation challenging rationalist self-improvement: understanding trauma and doing emotional work matters at least as much as optimizing beliefs.

2019-01.description: Baseline salience as therapeutic discourse exists but is not yet central to community identity. Δw=N/A (baseline). Rationalist heritage shows ambivalence about 'feelings work' while scattered discussions of meditation intersect with therapy.
key_manifestations: Scattered therapy mention threads across postrat accounts
Early meditation/therapy intersection in @nickcammarata posts on contemplative practice
Rationalist ambivalence about emotional work visible in discourse
Nascent IFS mentions beginning to appear via @QiaochuYuan

2019-02.description: Minimal growth as some accounts begin more openly discussing personal therapy experiences. Δw=+0.1. Cultural norm against 'oversharing' still somewhat operative but loosening.
key_manifestations: Personal therapy sharing increase across accounts
Early Internal Family Systems mentions via @QiaochuYuan parts work threads
Oversharing norm loosening visible in threads

2019-03.description: Steady minimal growth with discourse on limits of cognitive self-improvement: 'I've read all the sequences but I'm still anxious/depressed.' Δw=+0.1. Key insight feeding therapeutic turn: rationality alone doesn't heal.
key_manifestations: Cognitive limits discourse threads including @RomeoStevens76 on meditation vs rationality
Thinking vs feeling work contrast emerging in @meditationstuff threads
Therapeutic turn seeds planted across multiple accounts

2019-04.description: Growing momentum as 'The Body Keeps the Score' increasingly referenced. Δw=+0.2. The book's emphasis on somatic trauma processing resonates with community seeking beyond cognitive approaches.
key_manifestations: 'The Body Keeps the Score' recommendation threads via @TylerAlterman and others
Somatic approach discourse emerging with @natural_rising contributions
Body-based healing concepts entering TPOT vocabulary
Book club discussions forming around trauma literature

2019-05.description: Continued growth as some accounts begin identifying as 'postrat' partly through therapeutic orientation—caring about healing, not just thinking. Δw=+0.2. Cluster begins serving as identity marker.
key_manifestations: Therapeutic postrat identity formation visible in @visakanv threads
Attachment theory discourse emerging via @jessi_cata relationship threads
Healing as distinguishing feature from LessWrong acknowledged

2019-06.description: IFS discourse expands significantly. The model's language—'parts,' 'exiles,' 'protectors'—begins appearing in TPOT vocabulary. Δw=+0.2. Framework provides shared language for discussing internal experience.
key_manifestations: IFS 'parts' language adoption spreading via @QiaochuYuan extensive threads
Shared vocabulary development with @meditationstuff contributions on inner work

2019-07.description: Summer steady state with growing discourse on childhood trauma and its effects on adult functioning. Δw=+0.1. Some vulnerability in discussing family dynamics as community develops capacity to hold difficult emotional content.
key_manifestations: Childhood trauma discourse normalization via @liminal_warmth threads
Family dynamics vulnerability threads with @captain_mrs contributions
Emotional capacity development visible in reply patterns
Community holding difficult content across accounts

2019-08.description: Late summer growth benefits from accumulated trust—accounts increasingly comfortable sharing. Δw=+0.2. Some threads explicitly discuss TPOT as unusually therapy-friendly space compared to other internet communities.
key_manifestations: Trust accumulation effects visible in @nosilverv vulnerability posts
Community comparison threads noting unique healing culture
Comfort increase with vulnerability across @limaborechat and others

2019-09.description: Fall brings increased engagement as cluster breaks 5%. Δw=+0.2. Some accounts begin explicitly offering peer support—not professional therapy but community care. Discussions of how online community can serve healing functions.
key_manifestations: Peer support discourse emerging with @Malcolm_Ocean community care threads
Online healing functions explored by @chaosprime and others

2019-10.description: Continued growth with 'shadow work' terminology appearing more frequently—becomes signature TPOT phrase. Δw=+0.2. Jungian influences entering through therapy discourse; some synthesis of rationalist analysis with depth psychology.
key_manifestations: Depth psychology synthesis threads gaining traction
Analysis + depth psychology combination explored by @thealexstone

2019-11.description: Pre-holiday slight slowdown while cluster maintains gains. Δw=+0.1. Some seasonal depression discourse—honest discussion of how holidays affect mental health normalizes struggles other communities might hide.
key_manifestations: Seasonal depression discourse via @goblinodds honest threads
Holiday mental health threads across accounts
Struggle normalization visible in community response

2019-12.description: Year-end reflection with 'year of therapy' retrospectives. Δw=+0.1. Cluster ends 2019 substantially above start (3.8%→5.5%). Therapeutic turn underway but will accelerate dramatically with COVID isolation.
key_manifestations: Therapeutic turn underway recognition in meta-threads

2020-01.description: New year brings 'healing' intention threads with accounts explicitly setting therapy/healing goals. Δw=+0.2. Pre-COVID period shows normal growth pattern. No indication yet of the acceleration coming.
key_manifestations: New year healing intention threads via @TylerAlterman goal-setting posts

2020-02.description: Continued steady growth as COVID emerges but not yet dominant. Δw=+0.2. Early discussions of anxiety about news; cluster begins absorbing collective anxiety processing as pandemic awareness spreads.
key_manifestations: Early COVID anxiety threads via @RomeoStevens76 nervous system regulation posts

2020-03.description: MAJOR SURGE as COVID lockdowns begin. Δw=+1.6. Cluster explodes. Collective trauma processing kicks in. Anxiety, isolation, grief—all require therapeutic frameworks. TPOT's existing therapeutic infrastructure proves valuable.

07_grey_tribe_political_identity.name: Grey Tribe Political Identity
07_grey_tribe_political_identity.description: The 'Grey Tribe' identity - neither Red nor Blue, libertarian-adjacent, techno-optimist, socially liberal but skeptical of progressive orthodoxy. Scott Alexander's original framing. Declining as political polarization makes neutrality harder to maintain and e/acc vs doomer splits create new tribal lines.

Grey Tribe self-identification common in bios
Libertarian-rationalist overlap discussions, @robinhanson prediction market takes
Neither-Red-nor-Blue signaling in culture war threads
